statement.para: Given a subspace W of \RNr[n], together with a splitting W=U\dotplus V, each \Vect{w}\in W can be expressed in exactly one way as \Vect{w}=\Vect{u}+\Vect{v}, with \Vect{u}\in U and \Vect{v}\in V.

proof.para: From the property that W=\span(U\cup V), we deduce that \Vect{w}\in W can be expressed in some way as \Vect{w}=\Vect{u}+\Vect{v} with \Vect{u}\in U and \Vect{v}\in V.
